# **Customer-Clustering-using-K-Means-DBSCAN-and-Agglomerative-Clustering-Hierarchy**

# **Introduction**

Despite the wide variety of techniques available for grouping individuals into market segments on the basis of multivariate survey information, clustering remains the most popular and most widely applied method. Clustering is a popular and widely used method for identifying or constructing data based market segments. Over decades of applying cluster analysis procedures for the purpose of searching for homogenous subgroups among consumers, questionable standards of using the techniques have emerged one of such is the black-box approach ignoring crucial parameters of the algorithm applied or the lack of harmonization of methodology chosen and data conditions. **(Source: [Awogbemi Clement Adeyeye and Akomolafe Abayomi Ayodele Journal](https://www.eajournals.org/wp-content/uploads/Application-of-Cluster-Analysis-A-Case-Study-of-Customer-Buying-Behaviour-Data.pdf)**)

# **Study Case**

![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

Do you feel anything has changed when the World experienced the COVID-19 Pandemic that kept us at home for almost 2 Years? If you think that only clean and healthy living behavior has changed, you are not completely wrong because that is the most visible thing so far. But there are things that actually change significantly in the daily lives of all of us. What has changed is our consumption behavior towards daily necessities.

Reported on the **[CNN Indonesia](https://www.cnnindonesia.com/ekonomi/20211229141536-92-740093/konsumen-belanja-online-ri-melonjak-88-persen-pada-2021)** page, Indonesian online shopping consumers jumped 88 percent in 2021. **[NielsenIQ](https://nielseniq.com/global/en/)** noted that the number of online shopping consumers in Indonesia who used e-commerce reached 32 million people in 2021. The number shot up 88 percent compared to 2020, which was only 17 million people. According to Rusdy as Director of NielsenIQ Indonesia, there are several things that make consumers' shopping interest increase during the Harbolnas period. The main factor is because users are waiting for free shipping (in Indonesian calls as "Free Ongkir").

**[Media Indonesia](https://mediaindonesia.com/ekonomi/441793/riset-745-konsumen-lebih-banyak-berbelanja-online-daripada-offline)** also launched a news with the title "74.5% of Consumers Shop Online More Than Offline". The pandemic momentum has made almost all the fulfillment of basic needs and various other activities diverted through digital services. People are now considered to be increasingly dependent on products and services that are presented through digital platforms, including consumer behavior that is increasingly encouraging to shop online. Research conducted by SIRCLO with the Katadata Insight Center (KIC), shows that the pandemic has made 17.5% of offline consumers start trying to shop online. There are various sales channels used by consumers to shop online, including marketplaces, social media and websites.

![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

From this news, we are required to create a business strategy to attract more customers and also to retain customers. One analysis that is often used to do this job is **Segmentation Analysis**. **Customer Segmentation** is used to map customers based on their shopping behavior and other aspects. This can help us to determine the right business strategy. The right business strategy allows the company to receive more profit with less cost and also to retain old customers and attract new customers.
